review: Even if youre a fan of anime we recommend you keep your distance from Mamodo Fury. [Nov. 2006 p.81]

title: Blood Drive
genres: Simulation | Driving | Racing | General | General | Vehicle | Combat
review: Still its not the worst thing on shelves right now but its $49.99 price tag isnt doing the game any favors either. Maybe as a deep discount title or even a digital download with some of the games more frustrating modes stripped out (let me run over zombies for ten bucks!) Blood Drive might have been a more attractive proposition.

title: Prison Break: The Conspiracy
review: Prison Break is a disappointment on all fronts. The fighting system has been badly implanted and the presentation is lacklustre. The only redeeming features are the sneaking around and the development of the plot but it’s not enough to keep this game from falling flat on it’s face. Someone throw the keys away.

title: Freestyle Street Soccer
review: Squarely intent on holding the middle ground in every sense of the phrase this isnt a terrible game but it isnt especially good either.

title: Dragon Ball Z: Taiketsu
review: Taiketsus button-mashing gameplay is shallow and simplistic even for a kids fighting title.

title: Family Guy: Back to the Multiverse
genres: Action | General | Action Adventure | Fantasy | General | Fantasy
review: A game that not even die hard Family Guy fans will appreciate. The jokes and crude humor are taken too far even for the shows standards. Couple that with drab gameplay and poor controls and youve got a game that should be avoided by most accounts.

title: The Golden Compass
review: The Golden Compass really isnt anything more than yet another game based on a movie that falls well shy of quality. ‘sigh The trend may never die.

title: Scourge: Outbreak
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: All that said Scourge is cheap and if youre looking for a no-frills co-op shooter to keep you and three friends mildly entertained you could do worse.

title: MotionSports
review: If your biggest complaint about previous such entries is that they didnt include horseback riding hang gliding or skiing then MotionSports might get you in front of the TV for a weekend of flawed fun. Otherwise we suggest leaving this one on the sidelines.

title: Looney Tunes: Acme Arsenal
genres: Action | Action Adventure | Fantasy | Platformer | Fantasy | 3D
review: A repetitive nature not yet seen in the current generation of gaming.

title: Real Steel
review: Incredibly tedious and horrible controls make this almost unplayable.

title: Soldier Elite
review: Aurora Watching is rubbish – don’t even think about buying it.

title: Deep Black: Reloaded
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Modern | Arcade
review: Deep Black: Reloaded is an underwater Gears of War clone. While a good idea in theory the execution here is all wrong. Frustrating action poor checkpointing boring level designs and enemies that take far too many bullets to kill. There are some good ideas here but you have to dive deep to find them!

title: Battle: Los Angeles
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: The gaming equivalent of buying a gourmet mince and cheese pie - youll be uncertain youve got your moneys worth and pretty sure you could have done a better job.

title: Montague's Mount
review: The entire time I played Montague’s Mount I felt lost helpless blind crippled and confused. Unfortunately that doesn’t make for a very good or interesting game.

title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
review: Its pure repetitiveness is enough to make any chocolate lover long for a nice salty snack treat. So make your dentist happy and stay far far away from this title. It will leave a very bitter aftertaste and have you reaching for your mouthwash.

title: SuperPower
review: A key problem may simply be that the international system is too hard to replicate under its current condition of relative anarchy.

title: The Cursed Crusade
review: Developer Kylotonn has crafted the least appealing fantasy brawler imaginable its stillborn mechanics drenched in over-compensatory cutscene-driven storytelling its charms limited to the lure of unlockable combos and abilities.

title: Ultimate Beach Soccer
review: The result is a brutally slow pace and a game that doesnt pack much of anything for anybody. The AI is horrendous the control is abysmal and the announcing... [Jan 2004 p.73]

title: Torino 2006 - the Official Video Game of the XX Olympic Winter Games
review: Huge sporting events dont translate well into video games as the developer goes for quantity instead of quality making it a sad button mashing affair.

title: Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer
review: Its what a bag of roast beef crisps is to a Sunday roast with all the trimmings. [Sept 2007 p.90]

title: Drive Girls
review: With poor graphics bad gameplay (despite some interesting points in the battle system) and bland story Drive Girls fails to match the quality of the popular franchise Senran Kagura despite some more than evident similarities in concept. The driving parts dont look like part of a professional game.

title: Air Raid: This Is Not a Drill!
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Historic
review: While not a total disaster [it] barely even offers cosmetic upgrades to the 2000 versions incredibly dull gameplay format. [Oct 2003 p.112]

title: Army Men: Green Rogue
review: Some of the worst gameplay Ive ever had the misfortune of laying eyes on and the entire look and feel of the game is seriously lacking.

title: Turning Point: Fall of Liberty
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Historic | Arcade
review: Shoddy nonsense. [May 2008 p.74]

title: 25 to Life
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: You have to struggle with touchy controls and flaws in the game logic. For example if you hang onto a human shield for too long the cops will just shoot your hostage to get him out of the way. How is that fair to anybody?

title: Pocket Racers
review: Pocket Racer[s] screams budget title in every way. The gameplay is generic even by mid-’90s standards the graphics are bland and the sound will leave you wanting a lot more.

title: Doctor Who: The Eternity Clock
review: The Eternity Clock is a simple platformer rife with tacky bugs abrasive puzzles and timey-wimey guff.

title: Wacky Races: Crash & Dash
genres: Driving | Racing | Arcade | Kart | Other | Kart
review: Wacky Races: Crash & Dash is not very well put together and suffers from lackluster gameplay.

title: Troll and I
review: I wish I could be more kind to this game considering it’s an indie title with big ambition but considering Horizon: Zero Dawn and The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild came out only a few weeks ago and how similar Troll and I is trying to be to those games there’s really no excusing it.

title: Senran Kagura Reflexions
review: Its a pretty denigrating game. In addition HD vibration and motion controls have to learn a lot of eroticism yet. If they wanted perversion they could have gone to the extreme and not stay in the bikinis with small moans and senpais.

title: RollerCoaster Tycoon 3D
genres: Strategy | Tycoon | Management | Tycoon | Business / Tycoon
review: The original game is still more complete and more fun than the 3DS version and it is 15 years old.

title: Brain Boost: Beta Wave
review: Also disappointing was the lack of any head-to-head or multi-player functionality; theres no unlockable content either. The games themselves are monotonous and dont really instill you with a need to play them repeatedly.

title: The Polar Express
review: This is a kids game. Its also a bad kids game. And theres really no getting around that.

title: Family Guy: Back to the Multiverse
genres: Action | General | Action Adventure | Fantasy | General | Fantasy
review: Macfarlane is a man of many talents. Understanding what makes a videogame great is not one of them unfortunately.

title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
review: This factory comes off more like a real industrial complex than the fantastic playground of a fop who makes candy with magical midgets.

title: 25 to Life
review: Nothing about 35 To Life makes it stand out -- save for perhaps the fact that we had to sit through a delay to get this product. Its not terribly fun the storyline is pointless and the gansta tone is utterly unnecessary.

title: Hello Neighbor
review: A confused messy stealth-puzzler with flaky physics and dodgy controls. Hello Neighbors attempt to do something fresh with a classic cinematic concept is to be applauded but the execution falls flat. A massive missed opportunity.

title: Coffeetime Crosswords
genres: Miscellaneous | Puzzle | Puzzle | General | Puzzle | Logic | General
review: In all honesty though its too pricey and the standard text input method will drive you absolutely crazy within ten seconds of trying to enter a word.

title: Ju-on: The Grudge
review: Regardless JU-ON: The Grudge: Haunted House Simulator provides very little entertainment beyond the surface appeal and jump scares.

title: Thor: God of Thunder
review: Thor for the 360 and PS3 is a sub-par God of War clone that does a surface-level job of replicating what makes that kind of game work while missing the point of what works on any kind of deeper level. If you like that style of game play either that series or any other games like it that have been mentioned. The lack of polish here makes it impossible to recommend as a purchase at any price although if you must rent it go with the 360 version since it lacks a mandatory 3GB install. If the movies fresh in your mind and you want a fun Thor game to play try out the 8-bit throwback on Marvels site or use him in Marvel vs. Capcom 3.

title: R.I.P.D. The Game
genres: Action | General | General | Shooter | Third-Person | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: Unlike the dedicated officers of the R.I.P.D. do yourself a favor and just let this one go. I don’t think this needs anymore words to get that point across.

title: Raven Squad: Operation Hidden Dagger
review: The worst part is the voice acting. [Dec 2009 p.77]

title: Monsters Inc. Scream Arena
review: Nothing more than an aggressive version of dodge ball which does contain some initial attraction that unfortunately quickly wanes.

title: Anacapri: The Dream
review: It is to the best of my knowledge the biggest point-and-click real-world-image game ever created. Sadly in all other respects it gives even the least of its peers nothing to aspire to. It doesnt take long to realize that the full screen images of Anacapri (the place) are the only good thing about the game.

title: Onechanbara: Bikini Samurai Squad
review: Zombies women and blood: a cocktail which hasnt come off as it should have in this poor action game.

title: Tony Hawk's Motion
genres: Sports | Alternative | Individual | Skateboarding | Skateboarding | Skate / Skateboard
review: Theres less meat on this than a turkey carcass after Boxing Day. [Feb 2009 p.68]

title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
review: While the game has a decent foundation it is lacking the polish that would have made this game at least fun. Avoid this game at all costs.

title: Cartoon Network Racing
review: This derivative kart racer is no fun for the entire family.

title: The Deer God
review: The Deer God starts off on an interesting note and features a visual style that catches the players eyes but unfortunately it does not capitalize on its assets and quickly becomes an uninteresting unappealing and repetitive game that could have been much more compelling had its best elements been fully explored.

title: Coffee Tycoon
review: Theres little for you to do other than play with staffing percentages and earn some cash to purchase new styles of coffee. [Mar 2007 p.67]

title: Universal Studios Theme Parks Adventure
review: Too few mini-games too little fun and frustrating navigation ruin what is essentially an interesting concept. The whole debacle lasts approximately three hours the first of which is spent locating all of the attractions and being told you can’t enter.

title: Resident Evil: Survivor
review: Looking for zombie-blasting kicks? Leave this one buried.

title: Realms of Ancient War
review: Quotation forthcoming.

title: Inkheart
review: You can replay those games for a little bit of replay value but the best use of this title is probably as a doorstop.

title: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 5
review: A disgrace. When double jumps arent the worst part somethings gone terribly wrong. [Dec 2015 p.78]

title: Turn It Around
review: Turn It Around is a one-trick pony thats still looking to perfect its one trick. The game lacks the diversity of play that has helped make other titles in the mini-game genre meet with at least a moderate amount of success.

title: Pacific Rim
review: A very bad fighting game that try to surf the wave of his popular license without any kind of result.

title: Alone in the Dark
review: Unfortunately if the Wii version of AITD is any indication as to where this series is headed then nostalgia may be all that is left for its many fans.

title: Star Wars: Flight of the Falcon
review: Where Flight of the Falcon goes wrong is in trying to make the GBA display 3D environments for an entire game.

title: Putty Squad
review: Everyone else looking to relive the past may be better off tackling one of the Blue Blur’s adventures though – and letting this blue blob fester in the pipes beneath the sink.

title: Motocross Mania 3
review: I wouldnt waste money on this even at bargain prices.

title: Burnout Legends
review: Given that the DS hardware is woefully underutilized Burnout Legends is simply a shoddy game. The essential ingredients are here but there are flash games that have had more quality work put into them.

title: Dead or Alive Paradise
review: And well that’s about it. You jump between islands (well still shots of islands) you give and receive arbitrary gifts from Zack and the other girls which supposedly determine who will and won’t be your friend (these girls really are quite shallow y’know) and you play a bunch of dire mini-games. If that sounds fun – Paradise is the place for you or Zack Island or whatever it’s called.

title: Battleship
genres: Action | Miscellaneous | Board Games | Shooter | Board Games | First-Person | Tactical
review: 3.5 hours of FPS/ Strategy hybrid gameplay that is truly awful. Keep away.

title: Battle: Los Angeles
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: A pointless waste of money. [May 2011 p.109]

title: Attack of the Movies 3D
review: Theres no reason to recommend this game to anyone. Its short but feels longer than it is because its so frustrating and poorly designed. The graphics are poor the 3D effects rudimentary and the controls are terrible. Other than that its fine.

title: Painkiller: Resurrection
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Fantasy | Arcade
review: Quotation forthcoming.

title: Umbrella Corps
review: Umbrella Corps is a poorly made spin-off and probably the worst game in the Resident Evil franchise. A bunch of interesting idea cant overcome all the technical flaws and the forgettable gameplay created by Capcom.

title: G.I. Combat
review: With only a few good features GI Combats disconnected and confusing nature will probably make you glad the war is over.

title: Driven
review: Rent Driven along with Squares Driving Emotion Type-S as its suggested in page 47 of Dr. Jack Kevorkians favorite book Final Exit.

title: Pimp My Ride
review: I honestly have to say that I had fun with this game just because the gameplay is so outrageously bad.

title: Godzilla Unleashed
review: Godzilla Unleashed has all the makings of a good monster fighting game and none of the content

title: DARK
genres: Action Adventure | Modern | General | Modern | Linear
review: A bland uninspired game with old-school gameplay and boring design. Think twice before you cross paths with Eric Bane.

title: The Walking Dead: Survival Instinct
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: Its not zombies you need worry about in the painfully dull The Walking Dead: Survival Instinct.

title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out of the Shadows
review: Out of the Shadows has all the trimmings of a fantastic brawler but none of it works as it should. For every highlight the game showcases there are multiple failures: shoddy controls a complicated combat system and far too many glitches.

title: Naruto Shippuden: Dragon Blade Chronicles
review: The coup de grace was slowdown that plagued the game from beginning to end even when running through the many vacant hallways.

title: Vampire Rain
review: It is a shame that VR is nothing more than a poor man’s Splinter Cell with a dash of Resident Evil thrown in for flavour.

title: Thor: God of Thunder
review: Destined to prematurely hit the bargain bucket of game stores worldwide Thor fails miserably in its bid to reignite the action and excitement that this summers blockbuster superhero smash brought to the big screens in waves. Predictably as a videogame movie adaptation Thor fails epically. Interestingly enough though as a cure for long-term insomnia it cant be highly enough recommended.

title: Project Root
review: Unfairly difficult and technically incompetent Project Root is a classic example of a good idea gone horribly horribly wrong.

title: Carnival Games: Mini-Golf
genres: Sports | Traditional | Individual | Golf | Arcade | Arcade
review: Poor controls and a ton of pointless gimmicks make for one frustrating round of Astroturf golf.

title: Raven Squad: Operation Hidden Dagger
review: Raven Squad is bland boring and definitely not fun. Avoid it at all cost.

title: Seven Kingdoms: Conquest
review: Seven Kingdoms: Conquest fails to do anything right. Balance problems technical issues pace story graphics…I can go on. It’s not worth playing.

title: Kengo: Legend of the 9
review: Youd think it would be hard to mess up a samurai game but developer Genki has managed to deliver a royal swordplay stinker with Kengo: Legend of the 9. [Dec 2007 p.76]

title: The Simpsons Skateboarding
review: Control is brutal in this game forcing players to grit their teeth and redo each maneuver multiple times before it registers correctly.

title: Blades of Time
review: First of all Blades of Time wasn’t a particularly good game when it was originally released seven years ago. And with this version showing even more performance issues than back then I cannot find any reasonable answer why this game was granted a re-release.

title: Rock Revolution
review: If Rock Revolution came out two or three years ago it might have been revolutionary but in 2008 its not even relevant. Uninspired presentation a tiny tracklist that includes no master tracks a complete lack of vocal support uninteresting gameplay and a barebones Career mode are just a few of the many ways in with Rock Revolution fails.

title: Legend of the Dragon
review: Whether youre a fan of the cartoon or a fan of fighting games Legend of the Dragon is a total disappointment.

title: Heavy Fire: Red Shadow
review: Heavy Fire: Red Shadow is just not good. It tries to be a decent game but just fails on every level. The inclusion of VR just adds hope that it will at least be fun for a little while but it turns out just being more of a headache. I figured VR was included to generate some interest in what is essentially a bargain bin title. It’s very basic but there is just no fun to be found here. I cannot recommend even trying this one out even to experience the VR mode as it just doesn’t deliver any kind of lasting appeal.

title: Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines
review: A crappy lock-on system snaps the Terminators weapon right to a target oftentimes one thats right underneath a grate and thus untouchable all the while ignoring a more obvious threat.

title: SoulCalibur: Lost Swords
review: The shame here isnt that this is a a bad beat-em-up. Its that its a good one saddled with so much nonsense and tedium that youre unlikely to care. [Aug 2014 p.78]

title: Dying: Reborn
review: Despite this generous clutch of problems there is an odd charm to the game. Its schlock is part of its allure and each time I loaded the game I felt as though I was returning to a well-thumbed piece of pulp horror trash or sliding an old VHS B-movie slasher into the machine – its cheap ghouls awash with scan lines. I found myself smirking way more than I was frustrated but I can’t in good conscience say it’s worth picking up outside of the bargain bin you’d find the films it takes its cues from.

title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: Potter fans will be disappointed by this lazy attempt that is substandard fare and lacks options. EA Bright Light will have to revolutionise its approach if the franchise is to end on a high.

title: Hello Neighbor
review: Unfortunately only an amount of frustration and badly made game is hidden in the tempting package. For a good horror adventure you must go elsewhere.

title: Looney Tunes: Acme Arsenal
review: Frustrating disheartening and broken in places: a perfect recipe for making kids cry. [Christmas 2007 p.95]

title: ECW Anarchy Rulz
review: In keeping with the fine ECW tradition this game is a vile piece of garbage thats a rip-off at half the price.

title: Left Behind: Eternal Forces
review: Left Behind: Eternal Forces misses on all cylinders. The game needs a serious tune-up on nearly every level.

title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
review: Plagued by a series of problems that go way beyond the awful controls the action just isn’t fun or rewarding enough to keep gamers wanting to see this through to the end.

title: Evolution Snowboarding
review: Not only is Evolution Snowboarding a lame snowboarding game but its a lame fighter as well so you know what that makes the whole game dont you?

title: Star Wars Episode II: Attack of the Clones
review: One of the most maddening problems is that each time you die (which happens a lot) you respawn at the beginning of the level. There is no continue option and you can’t skip the-story-so-far screens.

title: The Ripping Friends
review: This game is for little Timmy not for you.

title: Steel Battalion: Heavy Armor
genres: Simulation | Sci-Fi | Vehicle | Mech | Mech | Combat
review: As combat plays an integral part to Steel Battalion: Heavy Armor and if the Kinect controls worked flawlessly this game would have been a blast as you fought your enemies. To make matters worse checkpoints between deaths are far too long which makes it an effort to continue.

title: Godzilla
review: Its poor graphics repetitive missions and awful controls make this Godzilla a bad videogame.

title: Bubble Bobble Revolution
review: A very poor remake of a classic arcade game. The Level 30 bug definitely hurts the product but in all honestly it just makes a bad game worse.

title: Pure Futbol
genres: Sports | Traditional | Team | Soccer | Sim | Arcade | Arcade
review: Pure Futbol is a mess of a soccer game. Its cover claims that an authentic experience awaits but whats actually in store for players who pick up this game is far from the real deal.

title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: One of the worst Tie-Ins in videogame history. Theres simply no reason in the world to buy this game. Poor graphics and frustrating gameplay mean only failure.

title: Far Cry Vengeance
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: The graphics would shame a third-party N64 game - theyre that bad. [Mar 2007 p.74]

title: Touhou Kobuto V: Burst Battle
review: Touhou Kobuto V: Burst Battle fails in so many basic aspects of the fighting genre that it will be hard to enjoy the game even if you a are die hard Touhou fans. Gameplay is repetitive and boring the game falls short on contents and graphics feels so dated that this could be easily mistaken for a N64 or at least for an early PS2 game.

title: Randall
review: Overall I was left feeling empty whilst playing Randall. A game that tried very hard to shine with its varying gameplay styles but ends up failing on all fronts; and totally messes up the platforming elements making it frustrating to play.

title: Tenchu: Dark Secret
review: Don’t be fooled by the fact that it’s a familiar brand that Nintendo published it or that it’s a limited release: this game is a bad one.

title: Napoleon Dynamite: The Game
genres: Action | Miscellaneous | Puzzle | General | General | Puzzle | Party / Minigame | General
review: In the end Napoleon Dynamite: The Game does little to fight the stereotype of low quality licensed games.

title: Torino 2006 - The Official Video Game of the XX Olympic Winter Games
genres: Sports | Olympic Sports | Olympic Sports | Individual | Athletics
review: The result in single-player mode is a messy unresponsive mass of button-pushing and frantic joystick-twiddling that evolves from impossible to challenging to repetitive and dull in less than an hour.

title: Pocket Pool
genres: Sports | Miscellaneous | Parlor | Individual | Billiards | Billiards
review: Not only does Pocket Pool miserably fail to deliver an enjoyable game of billiards but its attempts at titillation are more depressing than anything else.

title: Speed Zone
review: Its well intentioned but underfunded. [Christmas 2009 p.64]

title: TMNT
review: Avoid this one like the glowing radioactive ooze that it is.

title: Aqua Teen Hunger Force Zombie Ninja Pro-Am
review: And to finish it off this game is just awful. That’s a shame really since I had hoped it would turn out acceptable.

title: Shifters
review: The fighting system found within Shifters is guaranteed to make just about anyone cringe. Calling it simple is a horrid understatement.

title: Legend of the Dragon
review: This strives for nothing and doesnt even make it that far. A poor game for a poor franchise. [JPN Import; Aug 2007 p.54]

title: Quantum Theory
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: Quantum Theory can hardly be congratulated for infringing on other games as it is hardly even capable of doing that properly. Albeit all attempts to be Gears of War Quantum Theory is no more fun than burning $60 dollars and to be honest burning money isnt exactly a lucrative or entertaining hobby.

title: Duke Nukem: Land of the Babes
review: If youre likely to be amused by the puerile humour youll find this mildly diverting and entertaining otherwise avoid - this is a genre thats overpopulated and there are far better examples than this.

title: Fight Club
review: Its just a waste of a strong license. I really hope Chuck Palahniuk the author of the book this mess is based upon had nothing to do with oking this game. Avoid at all costs even if its in the discount bin.

title: Agony
review: Agony represents everything that a horror videogame should never become.

title: Crash Boom Bang!
review: Crash Boom Bang is a mess. There are too many unneeded features not enough time was spent developing the important ones and hundreds of small hiccups and issues make this game feel like it should have gone through more inspections at every level of design.

title: Gauntlet: Dark Legacy
review: A hack-and-slash fest in its most basic embarrassing form -- and faulty at that.

title: Hour of Victory
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Historic | Arcade
review: From looking at it youd probably never guess it was an Unreal Engine game. It lacks any real distinguishing features struggles to run smoothly in places and aside from a few nice special effects never remotely approaches the expected visual impact.

title: Blackwater
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: A very poorly produced game with too many problems to be even considered as a possibile buy.

title: NFL Blitz 20-02
review: Theres so much more wrong with the game (especially the lack of multi-player and password save system – would a battery have cost that much?) that even the great sound and mediocre game play are swallowed up by this product.

title: Left Alive
review: I’d stay as far away from Left Alive as possible. For all of you hardcore Front Mission fans hoping for a proper sequel in the series you can bury those hopes and dreams. With a team consisting of so much talent behind it I truly wonder what went wrong with Left Alive. I love Square Enix games to death typically but this is frankly unacceptable…and it’s $60.

title: Defender
review: Dont confuse this game with the console games however. Console games good; GBA game bad.

title: Rocky and Bullwinkle
review: A game with no originality and not much excitement either.

title: Underworld Ascendant
review: Unfortunately the game is an unrefined mess full of bugs framerate drops and bad physics. It’s more a puzzle-platformer with stealth and some basic rpg elements instead of an rpg dungeon crawler and it’s not so immersive and free as the developers think. Maybe it will be improved in fact the graphic it’s good and so the locations design but right now it’s not the spiritual successor that backers deserved.

title: Wonder World Amusement Park
review: The presentations pretty ropey too. [Dec 2008 p.76]

title: Ready 2 Rumble Revolution
genres: Sports | Traditional | Individual | Boxing | Boxing | Combat | Boxing / Martial Arts
review: Ready 2 Rumble Revolution isnt one of the worst looking games on the Wii but it certainly is one of the worst playing games on the system.

title: Mike Tyson Heavyweight Boxing
review: The game is a mess from the opening bell to the K.O. punch. As for differences between the two versions nothing was touched up for the Xbox version and both games are virtually identical.

title: Crystal Rift
review: Based on classic RPGs such as Eye of the Beholder Crystal Rift feels like a poor adaptation. Dungeons are repetitive graphics are too basic and it causes dizziness when played with PSVR due to camera controls.

title: Traitors Gate 2
review: All up Cypher was disappointing. But I did feel a sense of accomplishment when I had finished albeit with some help.

title: Frogger 2
review: Definitely not worth the ridiculous 800 MP asking price. [Aug 2008 p.94]

title: Escape from Bug Island
review: It’s a boring ugly game with complicated controls and a B-Flick storyline. Who can’t wait for the US release!? [JPN Import]

title: Tamagotchi Party On!
review: The party mentioned in the title is a very short one and players will likely decide to leave it early to knock on other doors: Rayman: Raving Rabbids and Wario Ware offer much more fun for only slightly more cash.

title: 3D Classics: Urban Champion
review: While you can teach an old dog new tricks its still a dog. [Nov 2011 p.95]

title: Lucha Fury
review: Lucha Fury could be a decent brawler but the fun in its gameplay is brought down greatly by its bad controls.

title: Fluster Cluck
review: Not counting massively multiplayer delivery quests my top benchmark for delivery-style games is still Choplifter. Fluster Cluck can be found at the opposite end of that spectrum.

title: Combat Medic: Special Operations
review: Unfortunately these real-world feelings are nothing more than lapses in programming in this action/simulation.

title: Past Cure
review: Past Cure is many things: technically infuriating a slog and thematically inconsistent. While one can appreciate the effort of a small team trying to craft a game that does many things it cant seem to do any of them well enough to warrant any attention. With a glut of better games that tackle similar elements on the platform its very difficult to recommend Past Cure to people even as a quick diversion.

title: Dead Space Ignition
genres: Puzzle | Miscellaneous | Puzzle | Action | Puzzle | Shooter | Third-Person | Action | General | Sci-Fi
review: Filling the narrative gap between the two main chapters sounds original but the game completely fails. Ignition is a faux pas in Dead Space universe with annoying gameplay and horrible graphics: an experience you can easily and definitely avoid.

title: Pimp My Ride
review: If you must play Pimp My Ride try the 360 version. Play this version and you’ll put yourself through a lot of unnecessary frustration.

title: The History Channel: Battle for the Pacific
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Historic | Arcade
review: A bad game. You might assume that a company as reputable as the History Channel might take more care to protect their license but its clear that they just wanted to make a quick buck.

title: Sniper: Art of Victory
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Tactical | Historic | Historic
review: While Sniper: Art of Victory is superior to its brother in arms and the sniping mechanic itself is reasonably well implemented there are still too many flaws here to recommend it.

title: Torino 2006 - the Official Video Game of the XX Olympic Winter Games
review: Its something youll play for a little while but youll soon realize that watching the real thing is far more exciting. It sounds better. It feels faster. And youll get to see the podium and hear the anthem of the victors nation.

title: Darkstar: The Interactive Movie
genres: Action | Adventure | Interactive Movie | General | Interactive Movie
review: Darkstar made me feel like a time traveler. It is as if at the end of the last century fearing the 2K error apocalypse someone put this game in a capsule and only now a team of archaeologists has unearthed these artifact CDs.

title: Shaq Fu: A Legend Reborn
review: A nostalgic joke taken too far. Though there are postivies in the presentation the gameplay is laborious even draining. Shaq Fu outstays its welcome despite its meagre run-time which is far more offensive than its juvenile attempts at edgy comedy. Shaq shouldve known better than to put his name to this and everyone shouldve known better than to put money into its creation.

title: The Sum of All Fears
review: Meant as a game to ease beginners into this type of stealth genre. The way it does that ends up being condescending for experienced gamers and for beginners will be annoying due to AI glitches.

title: Kung Fu Rider
review: Kung Fu Rider is not a good game. The controls are terribly unresponsive the game punishes players unfairly and the level design is repetitive.

title: NBA Live 14
genres: Arcade | Sports | Traditional | Team | Basketball | Arcade
review: Yes it is playable. And some dribbling looks decent. But if youre looking for the next generation of basketball this is not it.

title: Coffin Dodgers
review: Coffin Dodgers fails in all possible ways: gameplay game modes tracks… Its nonexistent variety and its simple gameplay are the burdens of a game that had good potential.

title: X-Men: Destiny
review: I have no idea why such crimes against gamedom even get published. Simple advice: hands off! Well at least the sound is good.

title: Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer
review: The gameplay is similar to the PS3 version--but with a static camera limited hero skills boss fights that drag across multiple levels and mediocre PS2 graphics the end result is an irritating mess of pointless repetition. [Sept 2007 p.84]

title: Damnation
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: This third-person shooter is a trip into hell.

title: The Shield: The Game
review: The Shield is too little too late; what wouldve been a merely mediocre license tie-in is now due to its very late birth simply a bad game.

title: Orion: Dino Horde
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: Its out and it costs money despite being far from ready for prime time. Even as a quirky indie release with a budget price Orion asks for too big a leap of faith that itll eventually work out.

title: Dream Chronicles
genres: Miscellaneous | Puzzle | Puzzle | Hidden Object | General | Puzzle | General
review: Porting an adventure game onto a console system is always a risk: Dream Chronicles offers a boring gameplay poor enigmas and most of all a frustrating pixel hunting from the beginning to the end. Needless to say youll miss your PC mouse a lot.

title: Power Gig: Rise of the SixString
genres: Action | Miscellaneous | Rhythm | Music Maker | Music Maker | Music
review: Wasted potential is all I see here but the lack of quality in Power Gig doesnt make it any easier to see anything more. It simply isnt worth it for the guitar nor the game: buy a cheap Six String if you want to learn the strings leave this title alone.

title: Air Conflicts: Aces of World War II
review: Sadly the sound is the best part of Air Conflicts but who really cares about sound when the game looks below average and is virtually unplayable.

title: MTV's Celebrity Deathmatch
review: The outdated and unfunny jokes horrible fighting engine and lackluster visuals and sound make this a game that could have been but never will. Stay very far away.

title: Disney Sports Skateboarding
review: Why does the house of Metal Gear Z.O.E. Contra Silent Hill and Castlevania need to bestow upon us such mediocre kiddy fare as this? [Jan 2003 p.81]

title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Arcade Attack
review: First generation cell-phone games had more interesting gameplay.

title: Hollow
review: Hollow is an incredibly ugly game with the kind of plentiful technical issues that make it actively difficult to play. Those with a masochistic streak might derive some pleasure from its abrasiveness and its downbeat tone but most Switch-owning horror fans would be much better served playing through Resident Evil Revelations and its sequel for the umpteenth time.

title: Legends of Pegasus
review: Legends of Pegasus had a grand plan but developer Novacore didnt come close to pulling off what it set out to do. Like storied Bellerophon its hubris has proved its ultimate undoing.

title: Power Gig: Rise of the SixString
genres: Action | Miscellaneous | Rhythm | Music Maker | Music Maker | Music
review: There are songs to play you cant get anywhere else but you should really ask yourself if you to play them on a real-fake guitar.

title: Damnation
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: Damnation sucks at every front. The futuristic cowboy setting is lame the shootouts are boring and the story is just stupid. Damnation will ruin your day your marriage and even your life.

title: Alekhine's Gun
review: Alekhine’s Gun is a title where the ambition of design outmatches the execution with gusto.

title: Jeremy McGrath Supercross World
review: Just too troubled to even bother renting. [May 2002 p.112]

title: Torrente
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: Its a slow-paced shooter with shoddy AI dated graphics and a frustrating design. Even though its good for a few irreverent laughs its not worth paying for even in the bargain bin.

title: Umbrella Corps
review: Umbrella Corps is a big game from a major publisher in a popular franchise in that franchise’s anniversary year and it’s both awful and dead on arrival. Now I see why Capcom didn’t tell anyone that it came out.

title: Risen 3: Titan Lords
review: This should never have come out on PS3 as evidenced by a sh.tload of technical issues. If you absolutely want this at best mediocre experience we advise you go for the PC version.

title: Double D Dodgeball
genres: Action | Sports | General | General | Team | Other
review: The game is lifeless dull and has no real goals. You can dodge your way to victory by dodging this one.

title: Arc of Alchemist
review: Arc of Alchemist does one thing right: it looks like a charm. It certainly doesnt play like one though and its performance is anything but enjoyable not to mention a dull and drab plot and characters that will leave any player disenchanted with any hint of joy that its visual environment might suggest.

title: Fight Club
review: With such a poor fighting engine youre going to get bored very quickly; tapping on one button isnt going to please most fighting fans.

title: Eternity: The Last Unicorn
review: Eternity: The Last Unicorn is a less-than-magical mix of misplaced PS1-era nostalgia and shallow Dark Souls mimicry. Nearly everything about the game from its fixed camera angles to its clunky combat to its copious backtracking is broken or irritating in some way. If challenge is all you’re looking for in a game perhaps Eternity: The Last Unicorn is for you. Everyone else will likely find it as fun as a sharpened horn to the eye.

title: Tokyo Tattoo Girls
review: Tokyo Tattoo Girls is a simple strategy game which can be fun in small doses but is sadly not interesting enough to keep you playing for long. The story is poor the characters are strange (and not in a good way) and the gameplay is lacking. The artwork and tattoos look gorgeous so it’s a pity they weren’t in a better game.

title: One Piece: Grand Cruise
review: One Piece: Grand Cruise is certainly a pretty game but there’s nothing much to do in its big world. Nothing fun in any case. It’s a boring short and annoying game that hurts the One Piece franchise.

title: Infernal: Hell's Vengeance
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: If you live a life of sin and gluttony Infernal will be waiting for you in the afterlife.

title: Tsunami 2265
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: Underachieves in all aspects of game design. The level design and gameplay are boring unimaginative and repetitive.

title: Jackass the Game
review: Sub-par gameplay with almost unbearable controls. Boring uninspired content from missions to visuals to the audio work. Not even hardcore fans of the show should spend more money than a rental on this sucker.

title: Bad Boys: Miami Takedown
review: Theres a lot of utterly stupid crap in Bad Boys: Miami Takedown and yet its kind of enjoyable in an I love watching car wrecks kind of way.

title: Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines
review: Its just plain bad. Whats worse is that either the developer or the publisher is fully aware of how atrocious Rise Of The Machines is. This is of course complete speculation but...

title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
review: Kids arent going to want to rescue the bad guys of the movie kids want to explore the factory swim in the chocolate lakes and hijack cars.

title: Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer
review: The Nintendo DS rendition of Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer is a short collection of generic levels that hardly relate to the movie at all.

title: Dead Space Ignition
genres: Miscellaneous | Puzzle | Action | Shooter | Puzzle | Puzzle | Third-Person | Action | Sci-Fi
review: As a pre-order freebie Ignition isnt bad but it isnt worth paying for or playing through otherwise. [Jan 2011 p.69]

title: 7 Days to Die
developer: Iron Galaxy Studios | The Fun Pimps
genres: Action | Action Adventure | Shooter | Survival | Sandbox | First-Person | Arcade
review: 7 Days to Die tries hard to provide the same experience we had on PC but it fails in its attempt due to the controller adaptation and the visible graphical downgrade.

title: Jeremy McGrath Supercross World
review: Heck even the character select screen looks boring. When you get to the game the drab color selection and lack of anything truly new will bore you to tears.

title: George of the Jungle and the Search for the Secret
review: George of the Jungle may be aimed at young children and their requirements may be different from that of a videogame reviewer but this is just nothing more than sloppy.

title: The Golden Compass
review: Even if you were completely charmed by Philip Pullmans work or enjoyed the movie adaptation theres absolutely no reason to give this game a try. Even the music as pretty as it is cant redeem such poor gameplay and atrocious presentation.

title: Enemy Front
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Tactical | Historic | Historic
review: A completely unremarkable WWII shooter with more bugs than Pixars second feature film. Theres nothing offensive about it its just subpar in every possible way from AI to controls to visuals to voice acting. Feels like a launch window 360 game.

title: Showtime Championship Boxing
genres: Sports | Traditional | Individual | Boxing | Boxing | Combat | Boxing / Martial Arts
review: Terrible. There is a split-screen multiplayer option but I cant imagine anyone whod want to participate and why would they? Sluggish controls poor attention to detail lack of customization and unbalanced difficulty all makes Showtime Championship Boxing a dud.

title: Street Jam Basketball
review: Unless you want to spend $20 to be bored to tears you should stay away from Street Jam Basketball.

title: Bad Boys: Miami Takedown
review: To put it simply its nearly impossible to enjoy Bad Boys: Miami Takedown without being completely naive. The presentation game play and voice acting are all about 10 years behind its a sad state of affairs.

title: NCIS
review: A point-n-click with minimal pointing and telegraphed clicking. NCIS fan? Still avoid this. [Feb 2012 p.98]

title: Drug Wars (2009)
review: Its better to avoid Merchants of Brooklyn. Its price is something out of mind when youll start to see its gameplay contents and the low level of technology of this game.

title: The History Channel: Battle for the Pacific
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Historic | Arcade
review: Just too little and far too late. The WWII genre isn’t exactly short on titles these days nor is the FPS genre. If you plan on releasing a game in either (and especially both) you had better bring your A game.

title: Girl Fight
review: Thanks to Street Fighter IV’s rebirth of the genre there is now a wealth of options to pick from when it comes to fighting games so there are no reasons to buy the generic sounding Girl Fight because this is a bad budget fighter with no redeeming qualities to enjoy.

title: Valhalla Knights: Eldar Saga
review: Ultimately Valhalla Knight: Eldar Saga suffers from an overall lack of polish as well as being an all-around boring game. Only those starved for an action RPG should think of treading the lands of Eldar. Everyone else need not apply.

title: Super Seducer: How to Talk to Girls
review: Outside of the cheese factor everything here is just dull. Loads of banal conversations wooden acting and obvious advice abound for every one moment you can laugh over Richard deciding to grab a girl’s rear end in what can only be described as a video game in the loosest sense of the term. This might be a weird thing to hear from a critic but just wait for the highlights to go up on YouTube instead. You’ll get the same chuckle-worthy stupidity and save some money in the process. It’s a game about being a pick-up artist that you should in no way consider picking up.

title: Fugitive Hunter: War on Terror
review: Fugitive Hunter seems to utilize random nonsensical damage instead of the target specific kind and the game’s defamation of the law of physics and its shoddy collision detection makes it seem like you’re constantly trekking through Jello. All that and no multiplayer. Bummer.

title: Star Raiders
genres: Action | Simulation | General | Sci-Fi | Space | Small Spaceship | Small Spaceship | Combat
review: The results feel neutered and unfinished.

title: King of Clubs
genres: Sports | Traditional | Individual | Golf | Arcade | Arcade
review: Ugly unplayable and not even close to being fun. [Nov 2007 p.92]

title: Langrisser Re:Incarnation -TENSEI-
review: This is not the worst game but when there’s so much better out there there really is no reason to play it.

title: ShellShock 2: Blood Trails
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Third-Person | Historic | Historic | Historic | Arcade
review: Shellshock 2 combines technical inferiority as a shooter with a woeful attempt at survival horror. It’s kicked around and stomped to death by Call Of Duty and Silent Hill in their respective genres and is thus left as an entirely useless exercise in gaming terms.

title: Fireburst
genres: Driving | Racing | Simulation | Rally / Offroad | Rally / Offroad | Automobile
review: The ideas are good but not their implementation. There are some serious issues when it comes to the difficulty and level design that sadly ruin the general experience.

title: Rambo: The Video Game
review: Quotation forthcoming.

title: Jekyll & Hyde (2001)
review: You are apt to play the same segments over and over ad nauseam. Perhaps a more appropriate title might have been Groundhog Day II.

title: The Expendables 2 Videogame
genres: Action | General | Shooter | Third-Person | Shoot-'Em-Up | Modern | Top-Down
review: The controls are clunky the graphics are student project-basic the plot isnt worth discussing and the levels so repetitive youll have seen all it has to offer within half an hour.

title: David Beckham Soccer
review: Its presentation is laughable to the point where it probably would have been unimpressive even on the Game Boy Color.

title: Shadow Harvest: Phantom Ops
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Tactical | Modern | Modern
review: Stupid AI and sluggish performance are just two of the many problems that plague Shadow Harvest: Phantom Ops.

title: Takedown: Red Sabre
genres: Action | Shooter | General | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Tactical
review: Financial issues killed an old-school promising shooter in its own cradle.

title: Destroy All Humans! Path of the Furon
review: Unless something drastic happens to the series perhaps THQ is better putting this old dog down.

title: The Walking Dead: Survival Instinct
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: What could have been a great game has turned out to be the exact opposite: a rushed effort supported with ugly graphics and boring gameplay. Granted Michael Rooker and Norman Reedus voice acting is pitch perfect but thats hardly worth spending fifty dollars for... isnt it?

title: Past Cure
review: Past Cure shows a lot of love for specific video games and movies with a huge ambition to emulate them but the developers fell incredibly short of their target producing a very troubled game in pretty much every aspect except for the soundtrack.

title: March of the Penguins
review: Its an extremely challenging set of minigames based on the most unlikely movie tie-in ever; give it a pass unless youre as calm patient and wise as Morgan Freeman.

title: Agony
review: In many ways Agony delivers an authentic experience of the archaic interpretation of ‘Hell’. Playing this game feels like torture an exercise in utter tedium as you perform the same tasks and witness the same ‘gruesome’ scenes. Unfortunately I don’t think it’s that meta it simply tries too hard. Squandering any potential it might’ve had the result is a shallow monotonous experience that’s not worth your time.

title: Transformers: Dark of the Moon - Stealth Force Edition
review: After the fairly good on-rail shooter released last year the Transformers come back on Wii and this time around they cant actually transform. However thats not the major problem. Transformers 3: Dark of the Moon - Stealth Force Edition is in fact a poorly executed action game with cumbersome controls repetitive action and a very short single player campaign.

title: You Are Empty
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Arcade
review: The stylish storytelling and the possibilities posed by the setting cant hide the embarrassing localization the unexciting fetch-the-key gameplay that most every other FPS has moved beyond and issues with the graphics that might have you reaching for the nearest bottle of pain relievers and asking what happened to quality testing.

title: Astro Boy: The Video Game
review: Poor playability a complete lack of I.A. and bad graphics spoil the chance for another good Astro Boy title. The fan should forget this one and stick to the old Segas Omega Factor.

title: Bomberman: Act Zero
genres: Miscellaneous | Puzzle | Action | General | Puzzle | Action
review: This game has less to see than most budget titles I’ve seen and it still carries a top shelf price tag.

title: Fantasy Hero: Unsigned Legacy
review: Fantasy Hero Unsigned Legacy should be an additive title with plenty to keep you coming back for countless hours. Sadly problems throughout the title make this a hard one to love. You may find some enjoyment but it likely wont be worth the trouble.

title: The Shield: The Game
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: The Shield in the end is a game that will only appeal to the true hardcore fans. If you love the TV series rent it otherwise take a pass.

title: Girl Fight
review: For a game that plays up its characters’ sex appeal Girl Fight is stupefyingly unattractive. The character models look like last-gen remnants and their complete lack of personality and combat pizazz makes them utterly forgettable.

title: McFarlane's Evil Prophecy
review: While all of this good on paper the game fails miserably when it comes to execution. Simply put Evil Prophecy just isnt any fun.

title: Chicago Enforcer
review: Fails on so many levels. It looks bad the control system suffers from lag and ineffective weapon designs the AI is incredibly unbalanced and the missions are a repetitive mix of elements.

title: Shrek: Super Party
review: Tears of joy rolled down my cheeks at the exact moment that I ejected this game from my Xbox. I then proceeded to toss it on the floor and violently smash it with a sledgehamer into a thousand little pieces. [Jan 2003 p.114]

title: AMY
review: Its hard to watch a game stumble with every step but AMY repeatedly demolishes any reason to suspect Occams razor shouldnt be employed; its a dreadful game and a miserable experience.

title: Kick-Ass
review: The game never really takes off relying on very few tricks to support itself from beginning to end.

title: Superman Returns
genres: Action | Action Adventure | Beat-'Em-Up | Beat-'Em-Up | Open-World | 2D
review: Superman Returns for the DS is a terrible game for numerous reasons.

title: The Incredible Hulk
review: A haven for low-resolution textures a lack of modern graphical technology frequent clipping issues and camera angles that pan into walls and obstruct your view. [Issue#10 p.56]

title: Mike Tyson Heavyweight Boxing
review: A collection of terribly constructed animations horribly limited replay and a create-a-boxer mode thats shallower than it first seems. [Sept 2002 p.31]

title: Farming Simulator
review: I wouldn’t have missed a thing if this game would have stayed away from consoles. This is just a boring technically absolutely unimpressive simulation that fails at the only thing it should rather do well: Simulate.

title: X Rebirth
genres: Simulation | Sci-Fi | Space | Large Spaceship | Large Spaceship | Civilian
review: You can (barely) fathom some good ideas about offering the players more accessibility in a saga that surely needed some but they soon get lost in the utter and complete mess of unfinished mechanics and bugs that sadly is X Rebirth.

title: Dawn of Fear
review: The developer’s love for Resident Evil and old school survival horror is obvious but this poorly made homage does nobody any favours.

title: Van Helsing
review: Unfortunately the graphics are simply horrible. The entire game lacks any real pizzazz and the entire game feels lifeless.

title: Yu Yu Hakusho: Spirit Detective
review: An insult to gamers and anime fans alike. With its charismatic cast and open-ended special-agent plot device Yu Yu Hakusho is a prime franchise for videogames but judging from this rush job the developer and publisher don’t seem to recognize this.

title: Demonworld: Dark Armies
review: There is a nice mix of unit types including heroes and the game even gives you spells to cast but the AI is so poor and the presentation so lazy youd be much better off buying the boardgame from an import store.

title: Dragon Booster
review: For the love of all that is holy stay away from this game it’s one of the worst examples of use of license out there.

title: Call of Duty: Black Ops Declassified
genres: Shooter | Modern | Action | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Arcade
review: Call of Duty Black Ops: Declassified has only its name going for it. Everything else is piss poor from both design and production standpoints.

title: Mistmare
review: If youre looking for a slow moving game with sub-par graphics poor gameplay and horrible controls then Mistmare is the game for you.

title: Mortal Kombat Advance
review: Oh my god. I thought the Game.com version of Mortal Kombat was bad. That cant hold a torch to this log.

title: Mobile Suit Gundam: Crossfire
genres: Simulation | Sci-Fi | Vehicle | Mech | Mech | Combat
review: Crossfire simply fails to do the one thing it has to do and thats to entertain. It takes archaic forms of gameplay and tries to update them for the next-generation but fails in almost every respect.

title: Megamind: Ultimate Showdown
review: If only some time and effort went into creating what could be an enjoyable romp. As it turns out this reeks of disappointment.

title: Target: Terror
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Light Gun | Light Gun
review: Yes it’s one of the worst games on Wii as far as tech goes and yeah there are countless other light gun experiences out there that’ll destroy this one in terms of pure gameplay but damn if this isn’t fun in its own seriously crippled way.

title: Iron Man
review: A PS2 port when theres an Xbox 360 version? This is a dreadful example of shameless corner cutting and an awful game. [Aug 2008 p.107]

title: Bruce Lee: Quest of the Dragon
review: And as if uninspired gameplay wasn’t enough the game is chock full of the dandiest bugs this side of my bathtub. Let’s see - where to begin. Clipping bad frame rates stuck fighters horrid camera movement moves that just don’t work and sluggish controls.

title: Rekoil
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: Rekoil is an uninspired first-person shooter that fails to deliver on any of its promise.

title: Zombeer
review: Even if you can get past the poor humour and lack of story the controls and combat just feel bad.

title: Women's Volleyball Championship
review: Women’s Volleyball Championship doesn’t do anything right. It does however fail miserably in a variety of different areas and remains mediocre in the aspects where it’s not a total failure.

title: MTV's Celebrity Deathmatch
review: But if you’re looking for a poorly-assembled gimmick of a game that serves as a friendly reminder of the good ol’ Celebrity Deathmatch days on MTV all for a discounted price of $19.99 then CD just might be for you. If you’re not looking for authenticity though stay far far away from this one.

title: Weeping Doll
review: Yes the game was finally starting to grab me ever so slightly and then it just sort of ends. It makes me wonder if the game was even finished or they just decided to wrap up and release.

title: Land of the Dead: Road to Fiddler's Green
review: Only the undead could enjoy a game filled with numerous glitches and a sincere lack of creativity across the board. Avoid this title like a flesh-eating zombie unless of course you just have to have all things Romero in your collection.

title: Escape Dead Island
genres: Action Adventure | Adventure | 3D | Survival | Third-Person | Modern
review: While playing through Escape Dead Island I was continually offended that anyone would be asked to pay for this experience. Any number of developmental issues could have caused this train wreck from budgetary problems or creative crises and well likely never know the whole truth. But as it stands Escape Dead Island is worth nobodys time.

title: Sonic Boom: Rise of Lyric
review: Sonic Boom Rise of Lyric is a real disappointment for Sonic fans. There is basically nothing positive to say about this game. Sonic deserves much better.

title: Gene Rain
review: Gene Rain is a complete waste of storage space. The game’s nonsensical and incoherent story confusingly bounces around like flubber in a basketball court. It doesn’t help that the voice acting is the worst I’ve heard since the original Resident Evil. Grouping that with the game’s sluggish controls its bland locations and its lack of originality collectively makes for one of the worst cover-shooters this gen.

title: Giana Sisters: Dream Runners
review: A promising concept is steamrollered in a game that doesnt really work as a platformer and breaks down entirely as a racer. Wed rather be kicked in the shins for eight hours than play this again.

title: Best of Tests DS
review: The game is easy shallow and repetitive. Stop reading this and buy Brain Age. Your brain will thank you.

title: The Walking Dead: Survival Instinct
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: The tide has begun to turn for licensed games thanks to great efforts like those from Telltale Rocksteadys Batman franchise and others. The Walking Dead: Survival Instinct is the exact sort of lazy cheap cash-grab that gave licensed games a bad name in the first place. To put a slightly less nostalgic twist on an old cliche: They dont make em like this anymore.

title: New World Order
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Tactical | Modern | Arcade
review: A game that simply attempts to cash in on the success of Counter-Strike and the Rainbow Six series by copying their themes but it ends up falling well short of the mark because of its terrible graphics engine its ill-conceived design and a campaign that takes only a few hours to (nearly) complete.

title: The Expendables 2 Videogame
genres: Action | General | Shooter | Third-Person | Shoot-'Em-Up | Modern | Top-Down
review: A shooting game that fails to understand how a Shootem Up works. If you fail with the most basic core of your game mechanic it says enough about your game.

title: Jenga World Tour
review: The developers of Jenga World Tour have done pretty much all they can to make the game reach its full potential - its just that it never had much to work with. Single cartridge multiplayer would have helped a great deal but even that wouldnt have lifted it into the average category.

title: Fighters Uncaged
review: The core fighting system is designed well enough but the Kinect control is lazily implemented and theres absolutely no variety to the fights. [Issue#66 p.93]

title: Dave Mirra BMX Challenge
review: The biggest challenge is dealing with the wonky physics. [May 2007 p.114]

title: Coliseum
review: Surprisingly dull and is lacking in both personality and depth...Sloppy shallow and ultimately forgettable the game never lives up to its undeniably catchy concept.

title: Kabuki Warriors
review: There are much better things to spend one’s money on. Like root canals.

title: Pool Party
genres: Sports | Miscellaneous | Parlor | Individual | Billiards | Billiards
review: The game is about on par with a chop-shop web game and does very little to use the Wii controls at all.

title: Magus
review: Unlike Deadly Premonition Earth Defense Force 2025 or other games that hide genuine depth behind an awkward presentation Magus has no hidden quality charm or saving grace. Its entirely witless and none of its mechanics strive for anything beyond mediocrity. Despite its issues though Magus is surprisingly breezy to play.

title: Ghostbusters
review: Games like this are the reason why movie tie-ins have a bad reputation. Technically sound but otherwise redundant boring and worse than the 2011 game Sanctum of Slime while totally overpriced even the multiplayer aspect cannot save anything.

title: The Simpsons Wrestling
review: A game that’s awful in every respect and will ultimately be a textbook example of a wasted license.

title: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 5
review: Avoid this one like the Black Plague.

title: Toy Shop
genres: Strategy | Tycoon | Management | Tycoon | Business / Tycoon
review: We can definitely see aspirations of greatness here so its too bad Toy Shop is so unpolished overall.

title: The Asskickers
review: With its dodgy controls and dull combat it is hard to recommend this game to anybody even a real retro brawler fan.
